reviewText: Adorable christmas series, perfect for my preschool kids :)

This movie is gorgeous, and a very cute story, but I just want to warn parents of young children:

Early in the movie, some kids tell the main character there is no Santa, and that parents are the ones who bring the presents. Now, obviously the movie shows there is a Santa, but to have the kids say it so blatantly seems to me to be unnecessarily taking the risk of planting a seed of doubt.

Also, if you care about the true origin of St. Nicholas, or a Christ-centered Christmas this film isn't for you. There are 7 or 8 retired Santas, the new Nicholas is kidnapped from an orphanage to be the replacement, and a few times, it is said that if one thing happens, "All the magic of Christmas will disappear forever." One of these things would be if the magic ball that gives Santa his powers breaks.

So all in all, a highly secular film with kids planting Santa doubts in the beginning, but if you don't care about those things, I think you'll love this movie. It is beautifully animated, the characters are loveable, and the message of pureness of heart carries the whole heartwarming film.
not in french language like wanted but still very good
Great family movie with all the kids. We love this movie.

This DVD contains last two Episodes of SantApprentice that is bundled together to make it a one film. These last two episodes are 24 minutes each apart from the other 48 episodes that are 12 minutes long. For those of you who are new to the series for the holidays, check this first. Those of you who seen this on TV before, best to buy the complete series on 3 DVD set. The 2-Film DVD from 2016 contains actual two Santa's Apprentice films made in 2010 and 2013. These movies are the best. You should check it out!
Great movie to get in the spirit of christmas. well made movie, may not be appropriate for children under 4 due to some language.
